DOC.brief_summary: to assess whether cessation of 12 months DAPT regimen containing Ticagrelor results in a hyperreactive phase of platelet function
DOC.brief_title: Is There a Transient Rebound Effect of Platelet Reactivity Following Cessation of Dual Antiplatelet Therapy With Ticagrelor - a Single Center Prospective Observational Trial
DOC.detailed_description: the study will be composed of a cohort of patients , who completed 12 months of DAPT with Ticagrelor (standard recommended dose for ACS - 90 mg BID), did not experience any clinical or adverse event during this time period and are about to discontinue Ticagrelor. We intend to measure the platelet reactivity for each patient on 4 time points - prior to cessation of Ticagrelor (i.e. while still on DAPT) and 1,4 and 12 weeks post discontinuation of therapy. There will not be a control group.
DOC.criteria: Age>18 underwent coronary stent implantation due to ACS completed 12 month of DAPT regimen containing Ticagrelor at standard dose (90 mg BID) any ischemic or bleeding events while under Ticagrelor any other Ticagrelor associated adverse effects planned for continuation of Ticagrelor for more than 12months post stenting according to the judgment of the attending physician. Unable to make informed consent .
